data.text: In 2014, the oil price shock hit #Colombia’s economy hard. The government, with the IMF, implemented a successful tax reform plan helping raise revenues and stabilize the #economy. Colombia’s Finance Minister @MauricioCard and Central Bank Manager share their story. https://t.co/VxicQ1UQ1V
India’s growth is projected to recover to 7.4% in 2018 - the world’s fastest-growing large economy. #IMFAsia https://t.co/zZBan1YFVt

Asia’s population is aging fast and the region risks getting old before getting rich. Asia needs to boost productivity and create more high-quality jobs. #IMFAsia https://t.co/WQeaH41Fvg https://t.co/ErbmcCLp1Y
Growth in China is projected to moderate to 6.6% in 2018 as financial, housing, and fiscal tightening measures take effect, and as net exports contribute less.  #IMFAsia https://t.co/GJAdSQx9lM

Colombia’s peace plan was almost thwarted by an oil price shock & economic crisis. Taking the IMF’s advice, Colombia responded by adopting a floating exchange rate, helping the country absorb the shock from lower oil prices & stabilize the economy. https://t.co/uNPkvXvGmm

Asia is expected to grow by 5.6% in both 2018 and 2019, 0.1 of a percentage point higher than expected in October. Take a look at the growth rates for each country. #IMFAsia https://t.co/WQeaH41Fvg https://t.co/qOZvgqMJjk

What is the outlook for Asia? In 2018 Asian economies will remain the main engine of the global economy, accounting for more than 60% of global growth. Despite the strong outlook, Asia’s policymakers will need to remain vigilant to risks. #IMFAsia https://t.co/WQeaH41Fvg https://t.co/PbUzxIlVN0

Malta’s gambling & betting industry helps trade & adds jobs, but it highlights a skills shortage & gaps in infrastructure. Read more: #IMFBlog #ChartOfTheWeek https://t.co/Rym31dWbIu https://t.co/fZEJMXXQQp

Indonesia’s growth is projected to increase to 5.3% in 2018 and 5.5% in 2019, led by a pickup in investment and consumption driven by infrastructure activity and stronger commodity prices. #IMFAsia https://t.co/WQeaH41Fvg

Asia has been in a sweet spot of strong growth and low inflation. While GDP forecasts for 2017–18 have been revised up over the last two years, inflation forecasts have been kept constant or revised down. But inflation may rise and policymakers should be vigilant. #IMFAsia https://t.co/vFrgSpms8V

Asia is already a leader in many aspects of the digital revolution. Policies need to encourage innovation in areas such as information and communication technology, education and trade. #IMFAsia https://t.co/WQeaH41Fvg https://t.co/LU41rXnnKh
